subject: Sexual Health
title: Sexual Dimorphism in the Brain
description: Learn Sexual Dimorphism in the Brain in one minute.

hook.text: Male and female brains show subtle structural differences, but the overlap is far greater than the gap.

buildup.text: The hypothalamus contains a region called INAH3 that is, on average, larger in males than in females.

discovery.text: Brain imaging shows men and women often use different neural pathways to achieve the same sexual responses.

twist.text: Most brain sex differences are averages of overlapping distributions. Individual variation exceeds group differences.

climax.text: The science of brain sex differences warns against stereotyping while acknowledging real biological variation.

punchline.text: More alike than different. But differences exist.

quiz.question: How do male and female brain differences compare to individual variation?
